I'm finding out there are a few advantages to being unemployed...emoticon_xangel
 I've been working on this a few days, it's for my granddaughter's birthday next week.
 
 'Elly' comes complete with a party dress, sun dress/slip and bloomers/cover-alls.
 
 http://i19.photobucket.com/albums/b189/Sandycane/CopyofElly1.jpg

Sun dress...
 http://i19.photobucket.com/albums/b189/Sandycane/CopyofElly1sundress.jpg
 and Rompers...
 http://i19.photobucket.com/albums/b189/Sandycane/CopyofElly1rompers.jpg
 
 All finished but the snaps!
 
 Let's see...if I were to sell this...at my previous rate of pay x # of hours...I'd have to charge $312 (not counting material).
 
 Hey! If you want cheap, go to WalMart! 
 emoticon_xhoho

We had the birthday party last night and Elly was a whopping success!
 My 6 year old granddaughter loved the doll - hung on to her all night!
 Priceless. emoticon_love

a horny elephant!:)

 
 emoticon_frazzled I don't get it.

That IS a good job.
 
 Kudos.

that 'thing' in its face looks like a uhm .. kinda phallic emoticon_frazzled

 
 Oh, I see...you're one of those men who don't think above the waist.emoticon_xdonno
 
 Do umbrella handles, candy canes and real elephants make you think of sex, too?
 
 I thought that might be what you're thinking but, since it is obviously a Girl elephant, it didn't make sense to me.
 Get your head(s) out of the gutter for crying out loud - this is a little girls birthday present.

Thanks for the compliments Symbiote and Zardoz.
 Good to know at least some here know the difference between Art and porn. emoticon_xhoho
 
 The 6 year old's 9 year old sister was a bit jealous so I'm going to have to make another one for her October birthday - with a different head, of course, either a bunny or a mouse. ;)

This pattern is for a 15" doll so, I'm going to enlarge the head and attach it to the larger elephant body.
 Do you find anything pornographic about that? emoticon_frazzled
 Does that erect foot turn you on?:p
 
 http://i19.photobucket.com/albums/b189/Sandycane/Micescapades.jpg

Your weirdness is showing. emoticon_xdonno
 Better tuck it in. emoticon_xbouncer
 :)

Oh, I got it Winston. And it was funny. ;P
 
 But, I can also admire the work of someone who's skilled at something. Even if it's not a medium I use myself. I do sew at times...yes, a man who sews. Not that great but, in the past I made halloween costumes that exceeded anything the local mothers could produce on their own. *beems*
 
 But, I like hand-made items that are manufactured specifically for a loved one. I've been wanting to make a heavy-duty denium quilt for several years now. Have enough material for 2 but...I procrastinate. ={
 
 Lately, I've admired the leather weaves of floggers. A local BDSM artisan makes a host of such items by hand that are near machine perfect.
 And, while I doubt I'd ever use one...I want one. A nice cat o' nine tails. Purdy. 
 And Winston. Since you can't take your mind off of phallic shaped items, maybe Sandy here could borrow a nicely woven cane for some CBT on ya?
 
 ;P

Now wait a minute...I have a great sense of humor - normally. Surely you can tell that by some of my replies to EZ? emoticon_xagree
 
 I'm sorry I took offense to your joke. Since being terminated, I've been on an emotional roller coaster and it's been hard to find things funny.
 I went ballisticemoticon_xkill on one of my cats last night and cried myself to sleep.
 Extremely over-whelmed and under-funded. :(
 
 Zardoz,
 I've had the same plan for a denim quilt too!.
 Here's a picture I've saved of one I saw on the net that I'd like to make...
 http://i19.photobucket.com/albums/b189/Sandycane/ginghampatchquilt.jpg
 Very simple, batting and top stitching optional. You just stitch the squares, wrong sides together and one side has finished seams and the other has frayed/chenille-like seams.

When my wife and I were newly married, we were so poor that my wife resorted to sewing her own dresses. She bought those magazines with patterns of dresses, pants, blouses etc and I helped her trace the patterns and stitch the bits of fabric etc. I learnt to respect dress making.
 
 
 I knew there was something strange about you. Real men don't trace patterns and stitch fabrics. You should have manned up and joined the military and served in harm's way. 
 
 You're probably the guy in the Geico commercial who the color yellow makes sad.
 
 emoticon_xchickenemoticon_xchicken

You know what's sad?
 It's actually cheaper to buy 'off the rack' these days than it is to make something by hand.
 A pattern can cost you $10 and 'good' fabric is anywhere from $4 up per yard...not to mention your time. And the worst part is, you don't know if it actually fits or if you'll like it until it's finished! :p And there are no returns or exchanges either.
 
 What did you do in the military, EZ? Drill seargent? :p

a horny elephant!:)

 
 You should see her cat pics. emoticon_xangel

Today, I heard on the radio that the unemployment in the USA is close to 10% and there is no light at the end of the tunnel.

 
 It's much higher, but they lie to the public all the time about that.
 
 If they say it's ten percent, it's closer to 50.
 
 That's why the press keeps pushing stories about koran burning ministers or mosques at "ground zero."

On sewing and masculinity, a side point, but Union and Confederate soldiers used to do their own sewing frequently.
 
 Traditionally, ITO American history, men sewing has not been considered unmanly, but part of the same repertoire of pioneer skills that built this country from both genders.
 
 I didn't learn that, though, in school, but by knowing elders from the back woods, hearing their tales of other generations, and seeing what they could do. 
 
 Meaning, both firing a gun by day, and threading a needle in the moonlight.
 
 Real men can wash dishes and change diapers too.
 ;)
